There are four types of fronts , three moving and one stationary .	moving	types of fronts
In other words , a cold front is right at the leading edge of moving cold air and a warm front marks the leading edge of moving warm air .	leading	edge of moving cold air

Predation is a relationship in which members of one species consume members of another species .	consume	one species	members of another species
The consuming species is called the predator .	called	The consuming species	the predator
The species that is consumed is called the prey .	consumed	The species
The species that is consumed is called the prey .	called	The species that is consumed	the prey
A predator-prey relationship tends to keep the populations of both species in balance .	tends	A predator-prey relationship	to keep the populations of both species in balance

This causes the prey population to decrease , followed by the predator population decreasing again .	causes	This	the prey population to decrease
This causes the prey population to decrease , followed by the predator population decreasing again .	decreasing	the predator population

Competition is a relationship between organisms that depend on the same resources .	depend	organisms	on the same resources
Competition can occur between organisms of the same species or between organisms of different species .	can occur	Competition	organisms of the same species or between organisms of different species
It leads to natural selection within the species , so the species becomes better adapted to its environment .	becomes	the species
It leads to natural selection within the species , so the species becomes better adapted to its environment .	adapted	the species
Competition between different species is called interspecific competition .	called	Competition between different species	interspecific competition
It might lead to the less well-adapted species going extinct .	going	less well-adapted species
Or it might lead to one or both species evolving specialized adaptations .	evolving	one or both species	specialized adaptations
Or it might lead to one or both species evolving specialized adaptations .	specialized	one or both species

Commensalism is a symbiotic relationship in which one species benefits while the other species is not affected .	affected	other species

Ecosystems need a constant input of energy to supply the needs of their organisms .	need	Ecosystems	a constant input of energy	to supply the needs of their organisms

Most ecosystems get energy from sunlight .	get	Most ecosystems	energy	from sunlight
A few ecosystems get energy from chemical compounds .	get	A few ecosystems	energy	from chemical compounds
Unlike energy , matter doesnt need to be constantly added to ecosystems .	added	matter	ecosystems
Unlike energy , matter doesnt need to be constantly added to ecosystems .	need	matter	energy	to be constantly added to ecosystems
Instead , matter is recycled through ecosystems .	recycled	matter	through ecosystems

Two important concepts associated with the ecosystem are niche and habitat .	associated	Two important concepts	the ecosystem
Niche is the role that a particular species plays in its ecosystem .	plays	a particular species	in its ecosystem
This role includes all the ways that the species interacts with the biotic and abiotic factors in the ecosystem .	interacts	the species	with the biotic and abiotic factors in the ecosystem
This role includes all the ways that the species interacts with the biotic and abiotic factors in the ecosystem .	includes	This role	all the ways that the species interacts with the biotic and abiotic factors in the ecosystem
A major aspect of any niche is how the species obtains energy and matter .	obtains	the species	energy and matter

Habitat is the physical environment in which a species lives and to which it has adapted .	adapted	a species

Two different species can not occupy the same niche in the same habitat at the same time .	occupy	Two different species	the same niche in the same habitat	at the same time
This is called the competitive exclusion principle .	called	This	the competitive exclusion principle
What do you think would happen if two species were to occupy the same niche in the same habitat ?	occupy	two species	the same niche in the same habitat

Producers are living things that produce food for themselves and other organisms .	produce	Producers	food for themselves and other organisms

Food chains and food webs are diagrams that model this flow of energy .	model	diagrams	this flow of energy
They represent feeding relationships by showing who eats whom .	feeding	relationships
They represent feeding relationships by showing who eats whom .	eats	whom
A food chain is a diagram that represents a single pathway through which energy flows through an ecosystem .	flows	energy	an ecosystem
A food chain is a diagram that represents a single pathway through which energy flows through an ecosystem .	represents	a single pathway through which energy flows through an ecosystem	A food chain
Food chains are generally simpler than what really happens in nature .	happens	in nature
Thats because most organisms consume and are consumed by more than one species .	consume	most organisms	more than one species
Thats because most organisms consume and are consumed by more than one species .	consumed	most organisms	more than one species
A food web is a diagram that represents many pathways through which energy flows through an ecosystem .	flows	energy	through an ecosystem

It includes a number of intersecting food chains .	intersecting	food chains

Energy is passed up a food chain or web from lower to higher trophic levels .	passed	Energy	up a food chain or web from lower to higher trophic levels
However , only about 10 percent of the energy at one level is passed up the next level .	passed	the energy at one level	up the next level .	about 10 percent
This is represented by the ecological pyramid in Figure 24.6 .	represented	This	the ecological pyramid	in Figure 24.6
The other 90 percent of energy at each trophic level is used for metabolic processes or given off to the environment as heat .	used	The other 90 percent of energy	metabolic processes or given off to the environment as heat	at each trophic level
This loss of energy explains why there are rarely more than four trophic levels in a food chain or web .	explains	This loss of energy	why there are rarely more than four trophic levels in a food chain or web
There isnt enough energy left to support additional levels .	left	energy	to support additional levels	enough
It also explains why ecosystems need a constant input of energy .	need	ecosystems	a constant input of energy

A gene can be defined as a section of a chromosome that contains the genetic code for a particular protein .	contains	a section of a chromosome	the genetic code for a particular protein
A gene can be defined as a section of a chromosome that contains the genetic code for a particular protein .	defined	A gene	as a section of a chromosome that contains the genetic code for a particular protein
In sexually reproducing species , chromosomes are present in cells in pairs .	reproducing	species	sexually
Chromosomes in the same pair are called homologous chromosomes .	called	Chromosomes in the same pair	homologous chromosomes
During meiosis , when gametes are produced , homologous chromosomes separate .	produced	gametes	During meiosis
Thus , the alleles for each gene also go to different gametes .	go	the alleles for each gene	to different gametes
The position of a gene on a chromosome is called its locus .	called	The position of a gene on a chromosome	its locus
The different versions are called alleles .	called	The different versions	alleles

Interspecific competition happens when individuals of different species strive for a limited resource in the same area .	strive	individuals of different species	a limited resource in the same area
Interspecific competition happens when individuals of different species strive for a limited resource in the same area .	happens	Interspecific competition	when individuals of different species strive for a limited resource in the same area
Since any two species have different traits , one species will be able to out-compete the other .	out-compete	one species	the other	Since any two species have different traits
One species will be better adapted to its environment , and essentially `` win '' the competition .	win	species will be better adapted to its environment	the competition
One species will be better adapted to its environment , and essentially `` win '' the competition .	adapted	One species	its environment
The other species will have lower reproductive success and lower population growth , resulting in a lower survival rate .	resulting	in a lower survival rate

Looking at different types of competition , ecologists developed the competitive exclusion principle .	developed	ecologists	the competitive exclusion principle
Looking at different types of competition , ecologists developed the competitive exclusion principle .	Looking	ecologists	different types of competition
The principle states that species less suited to compete for resources will either adapt , move from the area , or die out .	adapt	species less suited to compete for resources

This is known as character displacement .	known	This	character displacement
An example of character displacement is when different birds adapt to eating different types of food .	adapt	different birds	to eating different types of food

Abiotic factors are the parts of the environment that are not living , such as sunlight , climate , soil , water , and air .	living	Abiotic factors

One of Pascals major contributions is known as Pascals law .	known	One of Pascals major contributions	Pascals law
This law states that a change in pressure at any point in an enclosed fluid is transmitted equally throughout the fluid .	states	This law	that a change in pressure at any point in an enclosed fluid is transmitted equally throughout the fluid

Large illuminated bibles and psalters were the typical forms of luxury manuscripts , and wall-painting flourished in churches , often following a scheme with a Last Judgement on the west wall , a Christ in Majesty at the east end , and narrative biblical scenes down the nave , or in the best surviving example , at Saint-Savin-sur-Gartempe , on the barrel-vaulted roof .	illuminated	bibles and psalters

For much of the 4th century , Roman society stabilised in a new form that differed from the earlier classical period , with a widening gulf between the rich and poor , and a decline in the vitality of the smaller towns .	widening	gulf between the rich and poor	For much of the 4th century

Another change was the Christianisation , or conversion of the empire to Christianity , a gradual process that lasted from the 2nd to the 5th centuries .	lasted	a gradual process	from the 2nd to the 5th centuries
The publication of vernacular literature increased , with Dante -LRB- d. 1321 -RRB- , Petrarch -LRB- d. 1374 -RRB- and Giovanni Boccaccio -LRB- d. 1375 -RRB- in 14th-century Italy , Geoffrey Chaucer -LRB- d. 1400 -RRB- and William Langland -LRB- d. c. 1386 -RRB- in England , and François Villon -LRB- d. 1464 -RRB- and Christine de Pizan -LRB- d. c. 1430 -RRB- in France .	increased	The publication of vernacular literature

The British scholar Ronald Latham has pointed out that The Book of Marvels was in fact a collaboration written in 1298 -- 1299 between Polo and a professional writer of romances , Rustichello of Pisa .	written	Polo and a professional writer of romances , Rustichello of Pisa	The Book of Marvels	in 1298 -- 1299

For example , the opening introduction in The Book of Marvels to `` emperors and kings , dukes and marquises '' was lifted straight out of an Arthurian romance Rustichello had written several years earlier , and the account of the second meeting between Polo and Kublai Khan at the latter 's court is almost the same as that of the arrival of Tristan at the court of King Arthur at Camelot in that same book .	had written	Rustichello	several years earlier	an Arthurian romance

Brane cosmology models , in which inflation is due to the movement of branes in string theory ; the pre-Big Bang model ; the ekpyrotic model , in which the Big Bang is the result of a collision between branes ; and the cyclic model , a variant of the ekpyrotic model in which collisions occur periodically .	occur	collisions	periodically

Ripple current is the AC component of an applied source -LRB- often a switched-mode power supply -RRB- whose frequency may be constant or varying .	applied	source

Allosteric sites are pockets on the enzyme , distinct from the active site , that bind to molecules in the cellular environment .	bind	Allosteric sites	to molecules	in the cellular environment
These molecules then cause a change in the conformation or dynamics of the enzyme that is transduced to the active site and thus affects the reaction rate of the enzyme .	cause	These molecules	a change in the conformation or dynamics of the enzyme

In this way , allosteric interactions can either inhibit or activate enzymes .	inhibit	allosteric interactions	enzymes
In this way , allosteric interactions can either inhibit or activate enzymes .	activate	allosteric interactions	enzymes
Allosteric interactions with metabolites upstream or downstream in an enzyme 's metabolic pathway cause feedback regulation , altering the activity of the enzyme according to the flux through the rest of the pathway .	altering	the activity of the enzyme
